text:
Time-series and cross-sectional data can be pooled in the same data set. Longitudinal
data are observations over time of multiple characteristics of the same entity, such as
unemployment, inflation, and GDP growth rates for a country over 10 years. Panel
data contain observations over time of the same characteristic for multiple entities,
such as debt/equity ratios for 20 companies over the most recent 24 quarters. Panel and
longitudinal data are typically presented in table or spreadsheet form.
